title: Integrating Cardano to Pairwise & Hosting the Cardano Awards
summary: Cardano lacks flexible governance tools optimized for best-in-class UX, boosting voter participation and that can serve multiple entities, protocols, and decision-making contexts.
solution: Enabling Cardano organizations to make flexible multi-stakeholder votes with custom voting power via a Tinder-like UX and liquid democracy. We will host the Cardano Awards as a pilot.
proposer_relevant_experience:
- MoeNick: Product Manager, ex-Giveth, ex-UnicornWallet, ex-MyDigipay, ex-Finnotech PM, expert in fintech and product management.
    - Twitter: [https://x\.com/moe\_nick](https://x.com/moe_nick)
    - GitHub: [https://github\.com/MoeNick](https://github.com/MoeNick)
- Marko Prljic: Design Lead, Head of Design at General Magic.
    - GitHub: [https://github\.com/markoprljic](https://github.com/markoprljic)
- Mahdi: Web3 Engineer, Backend Engineer, contributed to Optimism RetroPGF, DeepFunding and Pairwise for Starkent, specialized in algorithmic governance.
    - GitHub: [https://github\.com/mmahdigh](https://github.com/mmahdigh)
- Alireza – Full Stack Web3 Engineer with 8+ years in development, specializing in dApps since 2020. Contributor at Giveth & Pairwise.vote, building AI-driven Web3 solutions for a decentralized future.
    - GitHub: [https://github\.com/alireza\-sharifpour](https://github.com/alireza-sharifpour)
    - LinkedIn: [https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/alireza\-sharifpour/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/alireza-sharifpour/)

Advisors:

- Mathsguy – Researcher. Original author of Pairwise theoretical foundation.
    - Twitter: [https://x\.com/mathsguy](https://x.com/mathsguy)
- Jordi Baylina – Tech Lead and Founder at ZisK, ex-tech lead and Founder of Polygon zkEVM. Liquid democracy pioneer.
    - Twitter: [https://x\.com/jbaylina](https://x.com/jbaylina)
    - Linkedin: [https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/jbaylina/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jbaylina/)

sub_fields.title: Category Questions
sub_fields.description: Answer the following questions to determine the eligibility of your proposal.

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
- Introduces **two open\-source governance building blocks** **to Cardano**, Tinder-like voting UX and category-based liquid democracy.
- **Enables vote delegation by category** and delegating forward, allowing for turning bottom-up trust into expert-based decision making.
- **Battle\-tested product\. Proven in five Optimism retro funding rounds, distributing $50M\+ OP**. Now we will adapt it to serve multiple Cardano use cases, like retrofunding or tooling for project ranking. For example, it can incentivize voters in a gamified way to get to know and rank more projects on Project Catalyst, since they have to compare one project against another multiple times. 
- Show a prototype through** the Cardano Awards, a high\-visibility, real\-world test similar to a people’s choice award ceremony**. This aims to provide insights about preferred projects by multiple stakeholders in the community and rally people to see what’s being built on Cardano.
- The voting mechanism is designed with a **built\-in viral mechanism for governance**. It allows people to **delegate voting power through posts on X**, making governance UX seamless and highly visible. 
- **AI assistance**. Voters can see AI summaries of projects, making decision-making easier and scaling their capacity to rank projects.





The following video created for an Optimism round can give more context about the solution: [https://youtu\.be/E0HFugS\_Vjg?si=P3EKHGwdGT4N8G1h](https://youtu.be/E0HFugS_Vjg?si=P3EKHGwdGT4N8G1h)

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
- **A simple, fun and gamified UX for voting** and ranking Cardano projects.
- **Category\-based liquid democracy** with forward delegation and delegation revocation.
- **Community\-based insights** on favorite projects, voter behavior, and delegation patterns by stakeholder group.
- **High community engagement** blending governance with delegation via a post on X/twitter to spark viral participation.

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
The following are our KPI targets:



- 500+ unique ADA wallets participating in voting or delegation.
- 200+ public delegations via Twitter.
- 2,000+ votes cast through the Tinder-like UX.
- On-chain attestations are recorded for every vote and delegation.
- Comprehensive on-chain report analyzing voter behavior and delegation flows.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
We will integrate Cardano into Pairwise, giving the Cardano community two powerful governance building blocks.

# Governance Building Blocks:
- Tinder-like Voting UX. An intuitive interface where users decide in which categories to vote asd then see two proposals or nominees at a time, pick their favorite, and repeat until done. There are AI summaries to help learn more about the products. This makes ranking and decision-making simple, fast, and engaging for all participants.
- Liquid Democracy. Voting power can be delegated by category to different trusted experts. Delegates can also delegate forward, creating dynamic flows of trust and surfacing the most respected thought leaders in each domain. Anyone in the delegation chain can decide to vote on a specific category reclaiming the voting power that they have delegated.

# Pairwise Use Cases:
- Ranking proposals for governance decisions.
- Participatory budgeting.
- Retroactive funding.
- Selecting delegates and representatives.
- Any other decision-making process that benefits from category-specific expertise and community-driven rankings.

Pairwise has been successfully used in 5 Optimism Retro Funding rounds, allocating $50M+ across 1,000+ projects. Its simple UX, Sybil resistance, and category-based liquid delegation make it a natural fit for Cardano governance experiments where the community is empowered to not only decide on the Cardano constitution, but also on grants and other key decision for the ecosystem development through Project Catalyst and Intersect.

Any Cardano project, DAO, or organization, could reach out to Pairwise to set up a gamified vote for it’s specific use case.

# Pilot Implementation: The Cardano Awards
To debut Pairwise on Cardano, we will host the Cardano Awards Ceremony, where ADA holders, DReps, and builders will decide what has been “the best of the best” on Cardano in 2025.

# How it works:
1. Define categories (e.g., Best dApp, Best new project, Most Innovative Use of Cardano, Best UX, etc.).
2. Nominate projects via open community nominations or curated lists, for example, Project Catalyst projects.
3. Custom voting power allocation to multiple stakeholders like ADA holders, voters, builders, etc.
4. Voting or delegating by category. Delegation happens in one click, or even via a public tweet to spark viral buzz.
5. Gamified UX. Projects are shown two at a time; users pick their favorite; repeat until done.

# Why this matters for Cardano
- Engages the full ecosystem, from token holders to builders, through participatory and fun decision-making.
- Generates social buzz as projects and delegates campaign publicly on X (Twitter) they generate a viral flywheel of attention to Cardano projects.
- Builds governance capacity with a tested, user-friendly tool that can be repurposed for budgeting, retrofunding, and representative selection.
- Delivers granular insights on community preferences by category and stakeholder type.

We will bring battle-tested governance building blocks to the Cardano ecosystem, paired with a highly visible pilot to spotlight the Cardano community’s favorite projects

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
# Value to Cardano Community:


1. A reusable governance building block for flexible, granular and revocable liquid democracy.
2. Another reusable governance building block to rank proposals, host retrofunding rounds, participatory budgeting and similar governance use cases with a simple, fun and engaging tinder-like UX.
3. The Cardano Awards. A highly viral pilot that showcases and advertises the best projects in Cardano.



These governance tools will be reusable for future Catalyst rounds, other governance processes, Cardano DAOs and other organizations.





# Impact Measurement:


- 500+ unique ADA wallets participating in voting or delegation.
- 200+ public delegations.
- 2,000+ votes cast through the Tinder-like UX.
- On-chain attestations recorded for every vote and delegation.
- Comprehensive on-chain report analyzing voter behavior and delegation flows by stakeholder type.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
The Pairwise team has delivered governance tooling for multiple blockchain ecosystems with proven technical and event execution capacity.

# Feasibility validation:
- We have a mature product that has been used for five Optimism Retro Funding rounds, distributing 50M OP across 1K+ projects.
- We already adapted Pairwise to Starknet a non EVM blockchain.
- Past projects demonstrate successful wallet integrations, high-participation voting events, and open-source governance frameworks.

# **Optimism**
- 5 funding rounds.
- $50M+ distributed.
- 1,000+ projects evaluated.
- 924 community voters engaged.

# DeepFunding (Vitalik x AI)
- Using Pairwise to train AI models on human judgments about public goods impact.
- Combining liquid democracy with machine learning to shape the future of resource allocation.



# Starknet.
- Pairwise won a seed grant to integrate Staknet into the platform.



# Testimonial example:




![](https://i.imgur.com/aNmaw1z.png)





Pairwise is in the process of merging with Giveth, hence Giveth is representing Pairwise in this proposal.



Giveth also has a fantastic reputation in the Web3 public good space for shipping innovative products related to capital allocation, governance and token economics.

sub_fields.title: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: New Cardano UI and key integrations

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
In this milestone, we will deliver:

- Seamless integration of Cardano Wallets & Smart Contract Wallet setup
- A fully customized user interface branded specifically for the Cardano ecosystem, incorporating Cardano's visual identity

This UI will feature elements like simplified onboarding flows, category-based delegation interfaces, and the Tinder-like voting mechanism adapted for Cardano projects.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
- Pairwise must be fully operational with attestations on the backend at this stage, but secure authentication through wallet connection on the Cardano testnet. User can perform basic actions like viewing proposals or initiating delegations without errors.
- Wallet integration must support at least three major Cardano wallets, with successful transaction signing and balance checks verified through automated tests.
- A customized Cardano-branded UI.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
- A comprehensive set of GitHub commits documenting all code changes, including pull requests for wallet integration and UI customizations, with detailed commit messages outlining features added and issues resolved.
- A live testnet deployment link will be provided, allowing reviewers to access and interact with the Pairwise instance directly on Cardano's preview or preprod testnet.
- Screenshots and screen recordings of the Cardano-branded UI will be submitted, showcasing key elements such as the login screen, voting interface, and delegation options across different devices. Additionally, a brief report will summarize test results.

sub_fields.description: The month when this milestone will be delivered

sub_fields.title: Progress
sub_fields.description: Current status of the milestone

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Full setup of component infrastructure deployed

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
- A custom attestation smart contract optimized for Cardano, enabling verifiable, on-chain records of votes and delegations.
- We will also configure a sophisticated voting power model, uploading weighted parameters that account for multiple stakeholders such as ADA holders, DReps, and builders, ensuring fair and customizable distribution of influence across categories.
- We will deploy an X (formerly Twitter) delegation bot that automates public delegations via tweets, integrating seamlessly with Pairwise to enable viral sharing and one-click delegation flows.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
- The attestation smart contract is fully built and deployed on the testnet, successfully handling simulated votes and delegations with accurate on-chain attestations and no failures in transaction processing.
- The voting power model must be configured and tested with sample weights, demonstrating correct allocation across stakeholder categories
- The X delegation bot must be operational, allowing users to delegate via public posts with immediate reflection in the Pairwise system, and it should pass integration tests showing compatibility with Cardano wallets and error-free handling of revocations.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
- Deployed attestation smart contract's address on the Cardano testnet
- For the voting power model, we will provide configuration files uploaded to GitHub.
- The X delegation bot's functionality will be demonstrated through a live demo link, server logs confirming successful deployments, and sample tweets with embedded delegation proofs.

sub_fields.answer: The Cardano Awards Launch (Pilot)

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
- Deployment of all smart contracts to the Cardano mainnet, ensuring secure and scalable operations for live voting.
- Finalization and publication of a public list of nominated projects, drawn from community submissions and curated sources like Project Catalyst, covering multiple categories.
- Launch of community voting, incorporating viral delegation features on X and Farcaster to encourage widespread participation through social sharing.
- Onboarding of builders and experts as initial delegates, providing them with tools and guidance to participate effectively.
- Execution of a targeted marketing campaign, including social media posts, AMAs, and partnerships with Cardano influencers, to drive voter turnout and highlight the event.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
- The voting system must be live on the Cardano mainnet.
- The public project list must include nominees across categories, validated by community feedback.
- Viral delegations on X/Farcaster must function seamlessly, with public delegations recorded.
- The campaign must demonstrate measurable reach on social channels.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
- Detailed participation analytics reports, including on-chain data on votes, delegations, and unique wallet interactions.
- GitHub commits for the production environment, documenting mainnet deployments, contract optimizations, and any final adjustments.
- Screenshots and recordings of the live voting interface, and campaign materials, compiled into a shared folder for review.
- Social media metrics from X and Farcaster, such as engagement stats and viral delegation examples.

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
Total Request: 170,000 ADA



- Pairwise. Cardano Integration with Attestation Service - 150,000 ADA
    -  We will make Pairwise work seamlessly on Cardano. This includes:
        - Connecting ADA wallets so anyone in the Cardano community can participate.
        - Creating a Cardano UI kit and dedicated Cardano section in Pairwise for this MVP and future votes for the Cardano community. We would be excited to try an experiment with Project Catalyst.
        - Votes attested on-chain pseudonymously Each vote = signed credential proving eligibility & voting power (no real identity or wallet address exposed).
        - Zero-knowledge / selective disclosure proofs confirm voting rights while keeping voter details private.
- Cardano Awards – Design, Operations & Marketing – 50,000 ADA
    - A high-visibility, community-led event to celebrate Cardano’s best projects. Funding will cover:
        - Designing a voting power model tailored for The Cardano Awards to include multiple stakeholders in the Cardano community.
        - Event branding and visual design.
        - Customizing Pairwise for the Awards voting experience.
        - Coordinating with community stakeholders and nominees.
        - Running social media campaigns to maximize awareness and participation.
        - Handling project operations to ensure smooth delivery from integration to launch.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
This proposal delivers not one, but two reusable governance building blocks: a best-in-class, mobile-ready voting UX and a flexible, category-based liquid democracy system. Both will be built to be reusable by other Cardano projects, DAO, or organizations.



Governance, and specifically liquid democracy, is a key area of interest for the Cardano community. By providing a tested, production-ready implementation, we enable real-world experimentation that will help refine governance models for initiatives like the Cardano Constitution, Project Catalyst, and Intersect’s decision-making processes. Different implementations and live use cases are essential to discover what works best for Cardano’s unique governance vision. All our development will be open source.



Pairwise’s proven track record, used in five Optimism Retro Funding rounds to allocate $50M+ across 1,000+ projects, shows our capacity to deliver. The Cardano integration created under this proposal will be a permanent infrastructure, usable long after the Cardano Awards. Subsequent experiments will not have an integration cost anymore, although there will be an operation cost, which will be much lower.



The Cardano Awards Ceremony serves as a high-visibility pilot, stress-testing the integration in a real event that will:

- Engage ADA holders, stablecoin holders in Cardano, DReps, and builders with participatory, gamified decision-making.
- Showcase Cardano’s vibrant ecosystem to a wider audience through viral social media mechanics.
- Generate actionable insights on community preferences by category and stakeholder group.



This approach builds lasting tools while creating immediate engagement, delivering both short-term visibility and long-term governance capacity.

sub_fields.title: I Agree
sub_fields.description: I confirm that I have read, understand and shall adhere to the [Project Catalyst Platform Terms of Use](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/project-catalyst-terms-and-conditions/project-catalyst-platform-terms-of-use), [Project Catalyst Platform Privacy Policy](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/project-catalyst-terms-and-conditions/project-catalyst-platform-privacy-policy), [Terms & Conditions](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/project-catalyst-terms-and-conditions), [Fund Rules](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/fund-rules), [Privacy Policy](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/project-catalyst-terms-and-conditions/catalyst-fc-privacy-policy). I understand that providing accurate and truthful information is essential for my proposal to remain eligible to participate in the current Fund.
